intro: Gamochaeta procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and pond edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
